page.title: 13SOME IMPORTANT BUILDINGS.
page.content: We made a list of the buildings we thought were important in the town. We were surprised at how many there were. What is now the{Town Clock}was first a reservoir (since 1862) where people came to get their water. The Clock was added in 1903. We have a{library, post {office, police station, youth and {community centre, fire station, three {clubs, two railway stations, two {lifeboat houses, the Little Theatre, {the old lifeboat shed (now a craft {centre), and three halls.} Less important but very interesting are the surviving flint{fishermen's cottages, the old{shepherd's cottages}on Beeston Common and the Victorian{boarding {houses}in Morris Street. Some{two {storeyed wash-houses}remain, the down stairs contained the copper and mangle and upstairs by wooden ladder is where children slept when visitors came.
